translated: The Elder’s Birth Story🔽. The Chapter with King Kinkaṇiya’s Flower
The Elder Kiṁsukapuppha’s Birth Story
Seeing a flowering kiṁsuka tree,🔽I put my hands together in respectful salutation,
remembering the best of Buddhas,
I worshipped him in the sky.
Because of that good deed,
and because of my intention and aspiration,
having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṁsa heaven.
Thirty-one aeons ago,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements have been burned up,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kiṁsukapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kisukapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Kiṁsukapuppha recited these verses.
The Elder Kiṁsukapuppha’s Birth Story, the fourth.
